alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. Tammany, northern Livingston, southern Tangipahoa and south central Washington Parishes through 430 PM CDT... At 345 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bush to near Springfield. Movement was northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Covington, Ponchatoula, Walker, Abita Springs, Livingston, Albany, Folsom, Springfield, Sun, Natalbany, Robert, Bush, Killian and Tickfaw. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 16 and 59. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 22 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
